original: The second generation of Romanticism in Brazil was characterized by a preoccupation with themes of morbidity and death. This period also marked the emergence of social commentary within literature, a feature less prevalent in the visual arts of the time. Notable literary figures such as Antônio Castro Alves addressed the atrocities of slavery, while poets and novelists like Antônio Gonçalves Dias and José de Alencar highlighted the plig
